title: Ref Watch: Dunk red shows VAR works | Potter: It's a yellow
shortDescription: VAR's role in Lewis Dunk's red card as Brighton lost to Man Utd "shows the system works" said Dermot Gallagher, but Graham Potter felt he was treated harshly.

title: Swindon fan, 6, whose mum 'can't afford food' gives 26p to favourite player
shortDescription: Swindon Town are on the search for a six-year-old fan who wrote to the club saying his mum has "no money for food" - and still donated 26p towards his favourite player.

title: Ex-Liverpool man Brannagan on scoring four penalties
shortDescription: Former Liverpool player Cameron Brannagan on scoring four penalties in a game for Oxford United, the first to achieve the feat in the division's 138-year history.

title: CL hits and misses: City's statement, Mbappe's Real audition
shortDescription: Manchester City showed why they are Champions League favourites with their 5-0 thrashing of Sporting Lisbon, while Kylian Mbappe passed his Real Madrid audition.

title: Pep: Silva is the perfect player | 'There's a long way to go'
shortDescription: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola described Bernardo Silva as "the perfect player" after he scored twice in Tuesday's 5-0 thrashing of Sporting Lisbon.

title: Ferguson pen rescues Dons point at home to Saints
shortDescription: St Johnstone remain bottom of the cinch Premiership after being pegged back to a 1-1 draw by managerless Aberdeen for a share of the spoils at Pittodrie.

title: Premier League top-four race: Fourth place up for grabs?
shortDescription: We assess the runners and riders in the race for the top four, their form and their fixtures until the end of the season...

title: Papers: PSG, Bayern, Roma target Ronaldo
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Wednesday's national newspapers...

title: Bronze: I'm getting back to my best after playing injured for a year
shortDescription: England and Man City right-back Lucy Bronze is determined to put a "frustrating" period behind her and get back to her best after recovering from knee surgery.

title: Champions League state of play: Liverpool face Inter
shortDescription: The Champions League knockout stages continue on Wednesday as Liverpool travel to Inter Milan, while Bayern Munich take on Red Bull Salzburg.

title: Live on Sky: Peterborough vs Reading
shortDescription: Watch Peterborough vs Reading live on Sky Sports Football from 7.30pm on Wednesday night; Kick-off 7.45pm.

title: Ronaldo ends drought as Man Utd sink Brighton
shortDescription: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights from Manchester United's win against Brighton in the Premier League.

title: 'Amazing' Ronaldo earns Rangnick praise after breaking scoreless run
shortDescription: Cristiano Ronaldo ended his goal drought in emphatic style as Manchester United moved up to fourth with a 2-0 win over Brighton at Old Trafford.

title: 'I've not decided future'  - Mbappe hands PSG advantage over Real
shortDescription: Kylian Mbappe's injury-time strike saw PSG beat Real Madrid 1-0 in the first leg of their Champions League last-16 tie at the Parc des Princes.

title: EFL highlights, round-up: QPR stumble again; Wigan close gap
shortDescription: QPR stumble in Championship promotion challenge again, Cardiff beat Coventry and Sheffield United are held by Hull. Wigan close L1 gap and Exeter win L2 thriller.

title: Pep demands more from Man City despite 'perfect result'
shortDescription: Manchester City underlined their status as Champions League favourites with a ruthless 5-0 thrashing of Sporting Lisbon to effectively book their quarter-final place.

title: QPR promotion challenge stutters again at Millwall
shortDescription: Tyler Burey scored his first senior goal for Millwall as they dealt London rivals QPR's promotion hopes another blow with a 2-0 Championship victory at The Den.

title: Cardiff return to winning ways
shortDescription: Second-half goals from Joel Bagan and Mark Harris enabled Cardiff to make it back-to-back home wins as they beat Coventry 2-0.

title: Everton fan given three-year ban for racially abusing Burnley's McNeil
shortDescription: An Everton fan has been given a three-year banning order after being found guilty of using racially abusive language towards Burnley winger Dwight McNeil.

title: Henderson: Family affected by 'hurtful' rumours
shortDescription: Manchester United goalkeeper Dean Henderson says his family has been affected by "hurtful" rumours online, which is "totally false news".
